8.description: What's the opposite of bright, modern, and sleek.  Perhaps dollop coffee.  And they're this way on purpose.For all the Starbucks haters and beat up couch lovers, dollop coffee offers a very similar coffee to said coffee chain but instead of modern and clean lines, you'll get the ambiance only scratched tables and mismatched coffee mugs can provide.   It's very...now I'm not going to use the H word... counter cultural.Which works for me.  Feels just like home.  My coffee table is scratched too.  Game reconize game.  I ordered an americano and a salted bagel with cream cheese, red onion, and tomato.  Armed with caffeine and breakfast, I made my way back through the shop, which is surprisingly big.  The front section is more traditionally outfitted.  Small tables and chairs,  also longer tables with chairs.   Maybe some couches too, I can't remember.  Down a couple of steps is another section.  This is mainly couches and beat up furniture.  Like a crappy garden apt.  I may be wrong, but I think I remember that Laverne and Shirley had a garden apt like this.  High windows, with bars on them.  And very non starbucks furniture.It's not a bad spot if you're looking to get a cup of coffee and hang out for a minute.  And hey, remember, if you get any chance make sure to take it.  If there's any rule, make sure to break it.  Make your dreams come true.  Do it your way....Even if you are a H.youtube.com/watch?v=bJzF…

31.description: I have tried to like this place; it's a business within walking distance from my home.  I appreciate the good coffee and you can pick up a pastry or a slice of Hoosier Mama pie, which is a plus.The customer service is atrocious.  Granted I might not be the demographic they are catering to, but a simple "thank you" for taking my money would be appreciated.  I felt like I was in the Jewel this morning, but even Jewel's customer service has improved to a significant level over my experiences at Dollop. I honestly wanted to take back the tip I left in the jar.The barista was the last straw this morning - she looked at me as if I was a freak because I couldn't make out her mumbling of the coffee I ordered. When I explained this to her ("oh, I thought you said chai latte"), she just looked at me with disdain. I might write this off to a bad day, but this is not the first time I have experienced this service from both of these women.  Very disappointed.

34.description: A cozy cafe, great staff  with some good baked goods from Southport groceryThe Wifi needs to be better though. I hope they do something about itTopnotch otherwise

16.description: This place is the best! Cozy, comfortable, lots of space to work and chill out. Plus, their coffee is amazing! They have food too - sandwiches, salads, pastry items. I love this place and am so happy to have a neighborhood coffee joint that feels like home.

13.description: This place is so damn nice!  It's in my Buena Park neighborhood, on my way to the lake, so I stopped in for an iced coffee.  The place was packed with customers working on their devices, but it was quiet and clean.  Their menu was nice, and the price point was fair.I accidentally took a sip of another customer's iced coffee while I was checking in on Yelp, and they forgave me.  Oops!  I grabbed my coffee and banana and ran.  Hehe.

11.description: I gave 2 stars for this place because most of the drinks I have tried were not that good at all. I would definitely prefer "perfect cup" next to brown line damen station. The atmosphere was great and baristas were nice but I need a good coffee more you know. Anyway if you really want to try this place Just dont order latte prefer Nutella latte instead. It's still not that good i would expect something with Nutella would be better but it was Just moderate.

39.description: Really cute place. The sandwiches are really good. I'm not sure if getting the ceramic cups is worth it if you're staying in. I'm all about going green but the take out cups are bigger. If you're going to stay in, I would just order a small size of anything.The Internet here is awful. No joke, there's so much space to sit and plug in, but the wifi is constantly going in and out. Even after they reset the router, it's super shotty.

37.description: Nice place to study and have a coffee! The staff is very friendly and you can seat in the back in a kind of library room they have! Is quiet and has low volume music in the background...

0.description: I happened to be around Buena Park when I dipped into what I thought seemed to be a cute local café.When I walked in, I found what by all accounts is a local joint - but on closer research was the original lady of five or six locations in the Chicago metro area.I can see why Dollop has encountered such success. I originally only walked in for a black coffee, but I was so transfixed by the quality appearance of the pies available that I couldn't help myself. I had to have a piece. I chose a blackberry pie and never looked back.Let me be clear. I am not a coffee shop diner. I breeze by the pastry cases at Starbucks and Peet's with nary a glance. I normally drink coffee only. But at Dollop, I have no regrets. The rich coffee paired with the pie beautifully, and I was sad when it was goneI am definitely coming back.

38.description: Nice, interesting atmosphere. Good coffee, wifi, but I have to say nothing beats Everybody's Coffee a few blocks down on Wilson.

51.description: The baristas are nice, the coffee is great (they also sell whole bean Metropolis coffee so you don't have to travel up to Granville for it), and the food is great, too! I wish they had a patio outside for nicer days because Clarendon is a fairly quiet street with lots of opportunity to people-watch.

27.description: Great beef sandwich and great tea. They serve Metropolis coffee and have great seating space! Enough light for the nature walkers to come in and grab a seat or for the den crawlers to sit in the back. Nice music selections too!

32.description: What's the opposite of bright, modern, and sleek.  Perhaps dollop coffee.  And they're this way on purpose.For all the Starbucks haters and beat up couch lovers, dollop coffee offers a very similar coffee to said coffee chain but instead of modern and clean lines, you'll get the ambiance only scratched tables and mismatched coffee mugs can provide.   It's very...now I'm not going to use the H word... counter cultural.Which works for me.  Feels just like home.  My coffee table is scratched too.  Game reconize game.  I ordered an americano and a salted bagel with cream cheese, red onion, and tomato.  Armed with caffeine and breakfast, I made my way back through the shop, which is surprisingly big.  The front section is more traditionally outfitted.  Small tables and chairs,  also longer tables with chairs.   Maybe some couches too, I can't remember.  Down a couple of steps is another section.  This is mainly couches and beat up furniture.  Like a crappy garden apt.  I may be wrong, but I think I remember that Laverne and Shirley had a garden apt like this.  High windows, with bars on them.  And very non starbucks furniture.It's not a bad spot if you're looking to get a cup of coffee and hang out for a minute.  And hey, remember, if you get any chance make sure to take it.  If there's any rule, make sure to break it.  Make your dreams come true.  Do it your way....Even if you are a H.youtube.com/watch?v=bJzF…

54.description: Staff was very rude and not helpful as I have never been there before. Sad to say Starbucks people are friendlier and at least smile once in a while. First and my last time there.

48.description: Coffee tastes great and the seating area and environment are cozy. Food selection is weak but I could live with that. The problem is the baristas. They must have a rule against being friendly and are forgetting that they are in the service business. Every time I've been there, I had unpleasant time. Product alone can get you only so far. Right now they are enjoying being pretty much the only non-chain coffee shop in the area. As soon as another one that makes you feel welcome opens up, they will have to say good bye to their frowns or to their business.Summary: Lighten up folks!

44.description: Good coffee. Hot boys. Great music. That's all I really need for a study spot.No matter what time of day I go there is always a place to sit and spread out my work. That keeps me coming back.Dollop is definitely high on the hipster quota. This includes the atmosphere and the staff. Usually this would turn me off, but I let the positives outweigh the negatives at this place.The drinks and food are both really good, and definitely reasonably priced. If I'm feeling hungry, I always go for the brie and pear sandwich. It's so delicious! And only 6 bucks. The only thing that I would say is lacking here is the staff. Most of the time they are understaffed with one person behind the counter. I'm sure this is tough for them...making drinks, making food, and taking orders all my yourself. Their communication skills are always usually lacking as well. They really don't call out drink or food orders well enough. I've been waiting on one side of the counter for a sandwich for ten minutes only to find out that it was sitting on the other side the whole time. And they never brought it to me or told me that it was there. It's kind of like they do it on purpose. They've done this with drink orders too. Obviously this is really annoying, but it's not enough to keep me from coming back or from enjoying the place quite a bit.

24.description: This has become a favorite of ours. And its in our neighborhood, so we are there often.  The coffee and tea are great, the sandwiches are great, bagels and cream cheese, too.  But I LOVE the pies they have from Hoosier Mama!

7.description: What makes Dollop good is it has a true local cafe vibe. It also has plentiful space for using laptops or to catchup with friends.My suggestion would be to ensure staff know the differences between a latte and a macchiato. Macchiato is espresso, with a stain of textured milk.Also when a customer asks for extra extractions/espresso shots it shouldn't become a situation where baristas are in disbelief that anyone could actually want more than a double extraction/two shots and project a slight attitude.

49.description: Great place for coffee and relaxing. I come here all the time, is a really cute neighborhood coffee shop. The staff is really nice. They have wifi so is also a good place to study. It is a bit small so it can be hard to find a table during busy hours.

40.description: Love me some Dollop. Good food, unique flavored drinks, great customer service, and a prime location to get some work done.

53.description: I've visited just once and I did like the place however parking is impossible anywhere near the place - in the end I parked good 15 minutes away in a tightly packed one way street. But that's the only minus I can think of! Their internet is good, seats comfortable, their little library out back is great (with the long table in the middle it's perfect for study and craft groups!) and the cappuccino I ordered was very creamy! I'd probably visit far more often but the lack of parking makes it very difficult!

30.description: No wi-fi. Yes, they list it, and have 2 networks going, but it's almost impossible to connect. I would guess I've been able to connect about 10% of the time I've been there. That is on 2 different phones, a laptop, and a friend's laptop. I would think it's just me, but it's enough devices, and almost every post here says the same thing. The coffee is decent. I've had black coffee, lattes, and mochas. The coffee is alright, and the other drinks have been good. If I'm just looking for a latte or mocha to go I would come here, but that's about it. If I wanted to sit down I would go somewhere I could be confident I could connect to wifi consistently. The staff is good, and they have all been pretty friendly. In the afternoons they usually play uptempo music, and the place is jam packed with younger teenagers, so I 100% avoid it then (although I like the music usually). I've never tried the food, but it looks good.Due to the Wifi, and a lot of kids in the evenings I tend to avoid this place, unfortunately, because I would like it otherwise. If you are looking to sit and read a book during the day this place would be pretty good.

46.description: Stop in all the time with my daughter after school. Staff is always awesome. Love the games. Love the atmosphere. Only issue is that they are often out of bread and food by 5PM. Not sure why that has to be.

1.description: One random mid-summer evening, Rosa J. and hubby were looking for coffee at 2000 hour.  They spotted Dollop on the corner of Clarendon and Gordon Terrace in Uptown, but it was closed for the day...Well, that was how Rosa J. knew where to chill in the neighborhood zone of Uptown.  Her past encounters in Uptown were Ba*er & N*sh, Heri*age, and Ever*body's.  Dollop is another one that serves Metropolis.  Rosa J. actually paid attention to the special menu this time!  Instead getting her iced Chai fix, she had the spicy Mexican mocha.  That certainly was a correct choice for a semi-pleasant rainy Friday afternoon.  She didn't forget her Daddy J.; the obedient daughter got him a 20oz. Americano.  This Dollop location is near a school, so they saw many kids hang out here.  Children nowadays are gettin' fancy with their after-school activities...The wifi sporadically worked, but it was better than not working at all like some other places she has been.

55.description: HOME OF THE 4.00 DONUT.  There is a reason they don't list the prieces of the bakery goods. They are hoping you don't ask, with tax a, nothing special donut is 3.29. So if you leave the change for the barista, that's 4 buck's. I hate places that rip you off !!! The staff is moody and changes often. ONLY AN IDIOT WOULD REPEAT GOING BACK HERE.

9.description: This place is good except for the cockroaches!  Almost everytime I go I see cockroaches scampering around.

26.description: You know, I was hesitant to review this place on the grounds on the wi-fi in the past, but WOW have you guys hit it out of the ball park with your wi-fi upgrade.  This place can do no wrong.  The coffee is outstanding, tables large and home-ey.  Thanks for the upgrade in technology!!

25.description: What makes Dollop good is it has a true local cafe vibe. It also has plentiful space for using laptops or to catchup with friends.My suggestion would be to ensure staff know the differences between a latte and a macchiato. Macchiato is espresso, with a stain of textured milk.Also when a customer asks for extra extractions/espresso shots it shouldn't become a situation where baristas are in disbelief that anyone could actually want more than a double extraction/two shots and project a slight attitude.

12.description: I was starving after leaving for my flight at 5am this morning and finally getting time to eat at 10:30am. Thanks to Yelp I found a place that had free wifi for me to work until I checked into my lodging down the street at 2pm........  And this place seemed to be a Mecca for the locals....As soon as I walked in I noticed the old school big band style music playing in the background, an old school 50's metal radio cover used as a lamp shade, friendly staff, and the relaxed overall vibe of the place. A mix of tables with people lightly chatting to those with laptops studying in the back, or those eased back with a book in hand slowly sipping their coffee....It was busy with regulars ahead of me in line ordering.... what they ALWAYS ordered.... Because they keep coming back again and again.Michelle, who took my order with a friendly smile, and playful spirit recommended a pumpernickel bagel filled with tomatoes, cucumber, onions, chives, and cream cheese!! It was flippin AMAZING, unlike anything I've had before!! Those in line raved about their coffee and pie and said I must try them also. I believe I will just stay here for another hour and order again.... Why not?So I just ordered the ginger molasses cookie.... They only had one left and that bad boy was thick!! It was incredibly rich and sweet.... Would be even better if I had a coffee with it.... After eating half I decided to randomly share it with other people that had never tried it.... Each person seemed to enjoy it and smile in appreciation!! Should I order coffee now?.... For you guys I will.....Honey cinnamon latte was my next order, medium....  and we have a WINNER!! Is it bad that now when I come to Chicago I want to make sure I stay close to this place so I feel like a local too..... This latte was SO GOOD..... I can see they use quality ingredients and it just tastes more homemade than mass produced....  Overall, you will NOT regret giving this place a try!!

59.description: dollop is dope. lots of seating high and low, hard and soft. lots of outlets and wifi. coffee is coffee and up to scratch, served in cute mugs. cookie (ginger molasses) is huge. music is inoffensive. the lady who served me was bouncy and full of life, warm and welcoming, the whole experience was an enjoyable one!

21.description: This place is so damn nice!  It's in my Buena Park neighborhood, on my way to the lake, so I stopped in for an iced coffee.  The place was packed with customers working on their devices, but it was quiet and clean.  Their menu was nice, and the price point was fair.I accidentally took a sip of another customer's iced coffee while I was checking in on Yelp, and they forgave me.  Oops!  I grabbed my coffee and banana and ran.  Hehe.

17.description: I had a wonderful Iced chai and found a kids area tucked into this coffee shop. That's a great thing for all parents out there :) My husband had a latte and it was just okay. Would return for sure though.

10.description: It's really a cool place. Baristas are nice but size of the drinks are so small. So I'll give them $$

5.description: Really cute place. The sandwiches are really good. I'm not sure if getting the ceramic cups is worth it if you're staying in. I'm all about going green but the take out cups are bigger. If you're going to stay in, I would just order a small size of anything.The Internet here is awful. No joke, there's so much space to sit and plug in, but the wifi is constantly going in and out. Even after they reset the router, it's super shotty.

3.description: Great coffee shop in uptown but good luck finding parking.  I was visiting family and friends in Chicago. The gentlemen up front was friendly but very monotone, I could barely hear or understand what he was asking me.  The menu was basic, lattes, mochas, chais, etc.  Most tables were occupied by people studying, hey I'm OK with that.  I tried a mocha which I found was good but could have used a tad bit more chocolate.  They had pastries and saw some people eating some other food items.  With parking in the area being serious I don't know if is the best place to meet friends if you are not from the neighborhood.

35.description: This place stands perfectly on its own without a review. However, I have been going here for the past 6 years...maybe more and although I have moved out of Chicago, I recently returned for a week and went back to this amazing place. Certain aspects have changed but I will always love the unique energy Dollop has. This is a very special place and I am happy to have grown up in and around it. Also their new Gluten Free Snickerdoodle cookies are on POINT!

19.description: Love the atmosphere and the staff is generally super friendly.  There is a back room that is great for group discussions. The reason I'm giving 4 vs 5 stars is that the coffee is often so acidic that it curdles soymilk, leaving clumps of soy curd floating atop my cup o' joe. Mmm.

28.description: I love this place! It is a small, cozy coffee shop. Hands down they have the best chai lattes. Their sandwiches are great as well.

45.description: I am so happy this place exists. I've been studying at Starbucks and literally wanted to cry it was so painful and noisy. I randomly found dollop one day when I searched for any coffee shop that wasn't Starbucks! I have been back 4 times already that's how happy I am with dollop.The coffee & tea is made so well, they have creative flavors and everything I have tried is amazing. Some favs so far are: green tea late (brewed not syrup, thank goodness!), the honey & cinnamon latte and a cappuccino with almond milk.The dollop is huge and ideal for studying. There is a back room with lots of tables. The only issue I've had are other patrons who are loud but that's the chance I take studying at a coffee shop. Overall, people are pretty respectful though.Enjoy :)

33.description: Wonderful little coffee shop. One of my favorites in the city for getting work done. Their coffee and teas are fantastic, along with some great gluten free snack choices.My only complaint is that the wifi can get pretty slow at times, and if you go after 4pm or so, you'll be hard pressed to find a spot to sit, for they fill up fast. This isn't really their fault though. It's a great atmosphere for getting stuff done. No wifi time limit too which is great.

43.description: I really like this place. It's cute, they make delicious drinks and sandwiches, and the baristas are great. I love the Nutella latte. Only complaint would be the noise. I like to come in to study and the music can sometimes be BLARING... Which can be distracting because I didn't come to a coffee shop to have a dance party.

2.description: Really love this place. Authentically chill environment with great quality stuff. Coffee is amazing. I'm not a tea drinker so I don't know about that. I often go out of my way schedule work meetings here cuz there a bunch of different seating areas each with a different vibe so it's good for all different situations. Nothing pretentious, just a straight up cool place.

18.description: Pros: Iced coffee is perfect, service is spectacular, inviting atmosphere, anyone is welcome. Tons of seating and there's even a place for kids to play with high chairs in the back room. Local art on the walls. Cons: (only reason for 4 stars) this place sort of... smells. Is it the old furniture? The old books? Not sure. Am I the only one on Yelp that noticed it? It's a musty, dare I say... bathroom smell. I've been here three times and I smell it every time. It's not just me - my guest said they smelled it, too. Well anyway I would still come and it's a great experience!!

41.description: Great coffee; shitty WiFi.They need to reboot their WiFi a few times a day to make sure people can connect. There are a few bad actors that have viruses on their computers that consume all WiFi connections.Hey Dollop! Hit me up, I can help you out. A few of your regulars have bad virus problems that hog up all of your wifi connections. They are Mac users. Surprise, Mac peeps are ruining your WiFi.

52.description: I'd say this place is comparable to filter, except it has better food and a brighter environment. Not as crowded.  I especially love how they serve hoosier mama pie company pies. Nice comfortable place to study all day. I think my bf appreciated the instrumental starwars background music that was playing....a bit far from me but I think it's worth it to go here every now and then.

50.description: Good coffee, free wifi, nice vibe, and the best turkey sandwich around.

4.description: I love their cappuccino!! Way better than Starbucks! We like to go there and sit in the back. It's a really nice place to hang around. Get their morning sandwiches!

6.description: The staff here wear pajamas and never smile. It's kinda gross and a little rude. So if you're looking for people that clearly don't give a crap to serve you an over priced coffee, stop in.

22.description: Love the atmosphere and the staff is generally super friendly.  There is a back room that is great for group discussions. The reason I'm giving 4 vs 5 stars is that the coffee is often so acidic that it curdles soymilk, leaving clumps of soy curd floating atop my cup o' joe. Mmm.

15.description: Dollop, oh Dollop.  How can I write an objective review?  You symbolize the single life to me.  A time of living in the City, with fewer responsibilities.  A time when I could wake up late on Sunday, and wile away the day with the newspaper.  I think I had a couple of first and only dates here.  Perhaps  choosing to work from here today is both sweetly nostalgic and somewhat masochistic.  We cannot recapture our youth.  To get down to the important stuff, the coffee and pastries are both quite good.  Not setting the world on fire good, but solid.  Dollop gets an extra star for nearly perfect decor, with a wonderful tucked-away back room.  This is one of the best places to hang out in Buena Park, a small neighborhood that is not quite Uptown or Lakeview.  Now I will get back to living in the present moment.

57.description: I was starving after leaving for my flight at 5am this morning and finally getting time to eat at 10:30am. Thanks to Yelp I found a place that had free wifi for me to work until I checked into my lodging down the street at 2pm........  And this place seemed to be a Mecca for the locals....As soon as I walked in I noticed the old school big band style music playing in the background, an old school 50's metal radio cover used as a lamp shade, friendly staff, and the relaxed overall vibe of the place. A mix of tables with people lightly chatting to those with laptops studying in the back, or those eased back with a book in hand slowly sipping their coffee....It was busy with regulars ahead of me in line ordering.... what they ALWAYS ordered.... Because they keep coming back again and again.Michelle, who took my order with a friendly smile, and playful spirit recommended a pumpernickel bagel filled with tomatoes, cucumber, onions, chives, and cream cheese!! It was flippin AMAZING, unlike anything I've had before!! Those in line raved about their coffee and pie and said I must try them also. I believe I will just stay here for another hour and order again.... Why not?So I just ordered the ginger molasses cookie.... They only had one left and that bad boy was thick!! It was incredibly rich and sweet.... Would be even better if I had a coffee with it.... After eating half I decided to randomly share it with other people that had never tried it.... Each person seemed to enjoy it and smile in appreciation!! Should I order coffee now?.... For you guys I will.....Honey cinnamon latte was my next order, medium....  and we have a WINNER!! Is it bad that now when I come to Chicago I want to make sure I stay close to this place so I feel like a local too..... This latte was SO GOOD..... I can see they use quality ingredients and it just tastes more homemade than mass produced....  Overall, you will NOT regret giving this place a try!!

20.description: This place is no good.  It is almost impressive how often they get orders wrong, I would guess it is about 85% of the time.  But that part wouldn't be so bad if they were civil and polite about fixing the problem, they are actually really rude if you have the audacity to request your over priced coffee and sandwich be made the way it is supposed to be made.  GASP!  This customer just paid over $5 for a specialty drink and now she actually think she has the right to ask that we make it correctly!  Who does she think she is?!   If you ask them to toast something, they won't.  If you ask for something NOT to be put on your sandwich, they WILL put it on and if you ask to have something added, they charge you an additional fee and then DON'T add it.  There specialty espresso beverages are gross because the don't make them correctly.  I worked as a barista myself for 4 years, so I literally mean they do not make them correctly.  If you order a chai or a mocha or something that requires them to use a dry powder, they leave all the flavoring at the top in a disgusting display instead of actually mixing it into your beverage.  Also, who the hell still uses powder?!  They use nonfat milk every time, not when you request it - every time.  I suppose it is to skimp on cost, or they are dumb.  It's one or the other.  I have on more than one occasion had my order screwed up and after politely asking to have it made the way I ordered, they role their eyes and treat your very rudely.  There is one very tall girl that works there there, she is especially rude and the worst out of all of them.  She still does the thing where she thinks its "cool" to be rude to people. You know, how high school kids behave or really really dumb hipsters that give the rest of them a bad name? She acts like that.  Someone should pull her aside and explain there is nothing about that which is cool or appealing. She should probably throw up the next time she looks in the mirror, because who treats people like that and actually can look at themselves in the mirror?  On top of the rude and terrible service and their poorly made beverages, the rest of their food isn't very good either and they run out of their craptastic selection of ingredients within a few hours of opening most days because they are either again, trying to save money, or they are dumb and can't count.If it is a choice between this place and anywhere else, go anywhere else.

36.description: Simply the best coffee shop on Chicago's north side and I have been to all of them many times. The Metropolis coffee is made expertly by their staff with great latte art work and all. The nice menu of sandwiches are delicious, due in no small part to the great bread and fresh ingredients, and budget priced. Fresh pastries are available daily and the Rishi brand tea is the best served in Chicago. The atmosphere is eclectic with a wooden decor, soft lounge chairs, a separate back room which is great for meetings, and an eclectic clientele of students, musicians, artists, writers and book readers. And I saved the best for last, the staff! All are extremely friendly and eager to help. Michelle, the manager, is the best! Equally so are the rest of the staff including Michael, Shante (the extremely talented musician/singer), Lace, Johnny (the extremely talented close up card magician), Annie (the extremely talented actor), and Haley. So just come in and enjoy yourself!

14.description: Good coffee. Hot boys. Great music. That's all I really need for a study spot.No matter what time of day I go there is always a place to sit and spread out my work. That keeps me coming back.Dollop is definitely high on the hipster quota. This includes the atmosphere and the staff. Usually this would turn me off, but I let the positives outweigh the negatives at this place.The drinks and food are both really good, and definitely reasonably priced. If I'm feeling hungry, I always go for the brie and pear sandwich. It's so delicious! And only 6 bucks. The only thing that I would say is lacking here is the staff. Most of the time they are understaffed with one person behind the counter. I'm sure this is tough for them...making drinks, making food, and taking orders all my yourself. Their communication skills are always usually lacking as well. They really don't call out drink or food orders well enough. I've been waiting on one side of the counter for a sandwich for ten minutes only to find out that it was sitting on the other side the whole time. And they never brought it to me or told me that it was there. It's kind of like they do it on purpose. They've done this with drink orders too. Obviously this is really annoying, but it's not enough to keep me from coming back or from enjoying the place quite a bit.

58.description: Tried the meatball, it was pretty good! My partner had the vegan chicken, he calls it "good stuff". I wasn't blown away this time, but based on other reviews and checking out the menu, I will try BBQ pork and the vegetarian (fried tofu) in the future. It seemed like a bigger banh than Nu Lan or bm& co They didn't put ice in our reasonably priced fountain drink- felt very European! I don't mind, and I bet if you ask for ice, you can get it. A little dirty in mid afternoon on a Saturday- trash overflowing, crumbs on tables and floors, food stains on the walls. You don't need two people taking orders if the queue for food prep is so long, so could have someone keeping things tidy. And if you are the guy next to me reading a book long after you finished your sandwich, what the hell? Can you not see how limited seating is? Camp somewhere with more empty seats!

56.description: There are things i recommend from this place such as:- cafe sa đá - Vietnamese milk coffee- banh Mi - the Vietnamese sandwich- fried meat ball - cha lua chien- desserts- chè trôi nc Things I wouldnt recommend:- color sticky rice- bánh dày - the sticky white cake with the fried meat ball in between- chè chuiThe place is always clean which makes me feel comfortable walking in and coming back.

29.description: Unfortunately, I've only been here twice... but it was twice in two days. They have a wide selection of bahn mi here and at a very reasonable $5-$8 per. They come on large, flaky rolls. They first one I had was char siu, and I felt like the bread overwhelmed the subtlety of the meat. However, the pickled veggies and jalapeños still shined through. Then I had the BBQ pork, which was just a really solid sandwich. I like the selection of other sides they offer, such as mung bean candies and smoothies. I'm looking forward to the next time, which will hopefully be soon.

42.description: Rarely do people associate "clean, modern, and high-tech" with anything Vietnamese.  Well, these three (3) adjectives are appropriate to describe the Ba Le Bakery, located in the Arygle/Vietnamese town, part of the Uptown neighborhood.  I recalled my last visit at Ba Le over one (1) year ago.  I didn't join Yelp at that time, but this place left me a good first impression.  I would say Ba Le is a "combination shop."  It has an awesome digital board listing all the banh mi options.  In addition, there's a mini deli mart and a bakery to distract you from just getting "one thing."  Do you remember that famous We*dy's commercial some years ago?  "Only one thing??"  I would have to say it's pretty easy to walk out the store with a few items in your hands.  If you're a Vegan, with a capital "V," you're in luck because choices are plenty.  Hubby ordered the avocado veggie.  For $4.95, you can have a guilt-free meal with all of these wholesome vegetables.  I had the meat ball banh mi.  While they weren't extraordinarily, out-of-the-world delicious, they were pretty tasty.  Personally, I think banh mi should be a great replacement for typical Western-style fast food, for it's easy to carry on the road, filling yet not stuffy, and health-conscious!  I was drooling over those bejeweled macarons.  Each piece was $1.65.  I would say the price was reasonable in comparison to most bakeries in the city (charging $2 to $2.50 in average).  Well, macarons are one of my favorite dessert.  I was a bit sad to pass them up this time, but I knew it wouldn't be long until my next visit to Ba Le.  The precise location of Ba Le is on the corner of Broadway and Winnemac.  The closest transit station is the CTA Argyle Red Line station, approximately one (1) block east to Ba Le.

23.description: I recently came back from spending a year in Tokyo, disappointed by the Viet food, SO ready to have some amazing banh mi. What I got instead was pretty bad.It was take out w/ the pickled radishes on the side, so it won't be as good as fresh, but they didn't put mayo in the sandwich, the pickles were old & shriveled up... nothing like the awesomeness I grew up on.My mom noticed years ago that their quality went downhill, but i didn't notice anything until this tie around. Off day? We'll see...

47.description: This is the second time and I love their sandwiches. It's one of my wife's favorite places to get sandwiches. I would definitely recommend them to my friends and family. Plus their customer service is very good.

8.description: Even though there are a ton of Vietnamese options in the neighborhood, I usually do Tank Noodle. I felt like giving them a break (I had some last night) and tried this spot out today. It was not exceptional, but was not bad either. A-OK fits my experience pretty well. Getting a free extra macaroon didn't hurt either.I've read some complain about the price and maybe they got something different than I did. $5 for a bánh mì seems average now a days. Sure you can find some for $3 or $4, but $5 for the Chinese Pork one I got and the Turkey my dad got seemed reasonable. Both were good with my favorite part being the bread. I'm hard to please when it comes to bread. Their's today was crispy while also being soft and it had that rich buttery flavor that I feel it should have. They were a little light on the meat. The macaroons where a bit too sweet for my liking, but the texture was good.The decor reminds me of some fast food type shops I've been to in Europe. They have a lot of pre-made stuff to grab if you're on the go. They also pretty much have everything you'd need to build your own bánh mì like ham, pate, different sizes of french bread and a plethora of other items. Service was quick and nice too.

31.description: Amazing! The sandwiches are nice and big and cost only around $5. They're delicious and very authentic. They also have macarons and other desserts which are very tasty, but those happen to be on the expensive side. There are also many pre-made, but fresh items you can buy which are delicious as well such as the BBQ pork bun!

34.description: Debate settled.#1 here vs #1 at Nhu Lan. Bread better at Ba Le.Everything else, Nhu Lan.Ba Le's fillings were skimpy and I couldn't detect any mayo. I'll only come here for convenience from now on.Even though Ba Le's other offerings are seemingly plentiful, I don't think they're as good as Nhu Lan's either.Sorry, you are number 2.

16.description: Neighborhood place.  Thou shall not trek.Where is the rib eye hiding for $7.95?  The Banh Mi sandwiches continues to have chunks of veggie mega fillers (see photo, cucumber and tomato).  The main reason for 1-star less.Good to see that the modified business model has added affordable ($3-$7) good hearty grab-n-go meals.  Assorted pastry sale for $2.VENUE -- plenty of seating.  One of the places in the hood where you can hang out a bit.  Slacks on cleanup.

13.description: I was disappointed in the pack of quality in the food. The lemongrass pork banh mi was less than great. No more Ba Le for me.

11.description: This is an adorable Vietnamese bakery/food to go place in Argyle that I love. Whenever I am in the area, I always stop by to pick up a few treats to take home.Highlights: CA PHE SUA DA (Vietnamese Iced Coffee) - ~$4; FYI: It is REALLY strong. If you need a wake up call, this is it. I drank about a quarter of the cup and it got me wired. I would suggest diluting it with water if you can't handle caffeine. But it gets the job done, I was wide awake and very productive after drinking this.BANH MI (Vietnamese sandwich) - ~4-5; I like the #1, which is a combo of all the types of pate and ham in the sandwich. It is a good size for one meal and it is very filling. CHE (Vietnamese desserts) - ~$3-5; the store has a wide selection of che in the fridge and they are all so colorful. I would suggest the taro (khoai mon) or the che thai because those are my personal fave.The store also sells a wide variety of Vietnamese to go food that are pre-packaged and the quality seems fresh! They also sell macarons for less than $2/macaron, which is quite a steal but note, majority of the macarons have cracks in them so if you are thinking of getting them as gifts, have the worker select the prettier ones.The place also offers ample tables and seats for you to sit down and enjoy your food and drink and socialize.And unlike other Vietnamese to go places that are more "hole in the wall" type places, this place is very clean! The workers are friendly and service is fast!

39.description: (This review is exclusively for the bubble tea)DO NOT COME HERE FOR THE BUBBLE TEA. I highly doubt real fruits are used in the drinks, and if they are, they use a ton of sugar. Gf and I ordered the avocado and the mango, respectively. gf's sister got the strawberry. Avocado tasted like sugar water with just a hint of avocado, mango tasted like my bittersweet memories of my 5th grade gf (bad), and the strawberry tasted like artificial koolaid. The tapioca was way too firm and didn't have the chewiness that I expected. Come here for the banhmi, not for the bubble tea.

37.description: Sweet little Vietnamese bakery and sandwich shop! We only got the macarons since we just had lunch but this seemed like a fantastic place to grab a bite to eat! Service was great, and I loved the sections with pork loaf and other Vietnamese goodies!They were out of both the sugar cane drink and the chrysanthemum tea when we were there though, but hope to be back in the future!

0.description: I had a good impression of Ba Le Bakery when I lived in Chicago four years ago and decided to drop in for a quick dinner. Got the combo meal with beef noodle soup and pork cake banh mi. Soup was a little on the salty side but stayed light with lots of fresh herbs and tender meat bits. Sandwich was also very good although heavy on the jalapenos and the bread was just a bit more chewier than I like. I also like the prepared-food options - I bought two big zhongzi (is what Chinese call them), those pyramids of steamed sticky rice and fillings wrapped in banana leaves for just a little over $5 and got a fruity creamy dessert cup of pudding. I should note that the cafe is spacious, well-lit, and clean. Stays open relatively late and there might even be wi-fi? I want to compare with Little Saigon Baguette up the street.

38.description: If you want to get a good, fresh and cold bubble tea or drink in Argyle, THIS IS NOT THE PLACE TO DO SO. First and foremost, you cannot combine bubble tea flavors (which you usually can do at most places). Next, I had the strawberry bubble tea and it was sugar water mixed with very little hints of real strawberry. My sister had an avocado bubble tea and that was sadly the same. It might be a good place to get bahn mi sandwiches or other Vietnamese desserts, but NEVER come here for the drinks.

51.description: One of many Vietnamese restaurants in the area. It's a place you can sit down or take to go. It has a variety of options - make sure you have them prepare it fresh :)We ordered two bahi mi sandwiches and spicy chicken salad rolls. YUMM!Cheers and happy eating.

27.description: I stopped in for some Banh Bao and a Jackfruit smoothie. *pulls up a chair*Let's talk about this smoothie for a little while. You see, jackfruit is pretty rare in the States. We don't get that a lot here. So I found this out when walking by the Ba Le downtown. I popped in, and randomly ordered the smoothie with jackfruit to satisfy my thirst and curiosity. After the first sip, it was added to the list of things I'll recommend to people if they go for SE Asian food. Like most fruits, you can't really describe it in terms of other ones you've had. Imagine trying to tell someone the taste of an apple if they have only eaten citrus before. So try it.Anyway, the Banh bao are nice. Different from more Chinese ones as they have a quail egg in, and Ba Le only has pork-stuffed ones, from what I saw. They're a bit bigger than the ones you get at Wow Bao as well. Two is a meal; three is gluttony. So if in Uptown, and in search of a refreshing drink, quick sandwich, or something to steam at home, stop in, and give them some business.

32.description: excellent. wonderful food in a beautiful neighborhood. i always eat here when i'm in town...

54.description: I had the banh mi dac biet and pho ga combo.  Was amazing, best place I have been to in a while.

48.description: Even though there are a ton of Vietnamese options in the neighborhood, I usually do Tank Noodle. I felt like giving them a break (I had some last night) and tried this spot out today. It was not exceptional, but was not bad either. A-OK fits my experience pretty well. Getting a free extra macaroon didn't hurt either.I've read some complain about the price and maybe they got something different than I did. $5 for a bánh mì seems average now a days. Sure you can find some for $3 or $4, but $5 for the Chinese Pork one I got and the Turkey my dad got seemed reasonable. Both were good with my favorite part being the bread. I'm hard to please when it comes to bread. Their's today was crispy while also being soft and it had that rich buttery flavor that I feel it should have. They were a little light on the meat. The macaroons where a bit too sweet for my liking, but the texture was good.The decor reminds me of some fast food type shops I've been to in Europe. They have a lot of pre-made stuff to grab if you're on the go. They also pretty much have everything you'd need to build your own bánh mì like ham, pate, different sizes of french bread and a plethora of other items. Service was quick and nice too.

44.description: I've been here multiple times during visits to Chicago.  They are known for their bahn mi sandwiches but they also have other stuff like summer rolls, sugar cane shrimp, bottled beverages, rice puddings, and a large selection of baked goods. Its kind of like a Vietnamese fast food restaurant.  Everything i have had has been good.  I almost always get a bahn mi to go. Try it.  You will like it.

24.description: Lots of sandwich options, even for vegetarians/vegans. Filling, delicious, and reasonably priced. Quick service. I tried this place on a whim and will definitely be back.

7.description: Rarely do people associate "clean, modern, and high-tech" with anything Vietnamese.  Well, these three (3) adjectives are appropriate to describe the Ba Le Bakery, located in the Arygle/Vietnamese town, part of the Uptown neighborhood.  I recalled my last visit at Ba Le over one (1) year ago.  I didn't join Yelp at that time, but this place left me a good first impression.  I would say Ba Le is a "combination shop."  It has an awesome digital board listing all the banh mi options.  In addition, there's a mini deli mart and a bakery to distract you from just getting "one thing."  Do you remember that famous We*dy's commercial some years ago?  "Only one thing??"  I would have to say it's pretty easy to walk out the store with a few items in your hands.  If you're a Vegan, with a capital "V," you're in luck because choices are plenty.  Hubby ordered the avocado veggie.  For $4.95, you can have a guilt-free meal with all of these wholesome vegetables.  I had the meat ball banh mi.  While they weren't extraordinarily, out-of-the-world delicious, they were pretty tasty.  Personally, I think banh mi should be a great replacement for typical Western-style fast food, for it's easy to carry on the road, filling yet not stuffy, and health-conscious!  I was drooling over those bejeweled macarons.  Each piece was $1.65.  I would say the price was reasonable in comparison to most bakeries in the city (charging $2 to $2.50 in average).  Well, macarons are one of my favorite dessert.  I was a bit sad to pass them up this time, but I knew it wouldn't be long until my next visit to Ba Le.  The precise location of Ba Le is on the corner of Broadway and Winnemac.  The closest transit station is the CTA Argyle Red Line station, approximately one (1) block east to Ba Le.

49.description: One word; Bread.  Oh the bread!  I dream about this bread.  There are a lot of arguments over what makes a good sandwich.  Some say its the meat.  Others claim the veggies must be crisp.  Some rave about sauces.  All of these are legitimate arguments but I'm firmly in the camp that the bread is where a sandwich can either live or die a horrendous eating experience.  Ba Le does a good job on the filling (and there are some of them I don't particularly like) but the bread is the star.In fairness I've had better bread in France.  That's pretty much the list.  You want better bread, go to France.  Buy a ticket, spend the Benjamins and get that bread.  Now if you don't have the cash, dedication, or jetting spirit then just take the red line to Argyle and eat here.

40.description: I am a fan of the prices. For what the sandwiches cost, the taste is good and the portions are filling for a small person. You might  be a bit hungry if you can eat a lot. I ordered a vegan chicken sandwich, and I was impressed by the combination of flavors. I was a little disappointed by high sodium content. My stomach did not feel too good afterwards. I also ordered the Vietnamese iced coffee. It is very bold but it's very sweet. The combination of sweet and bitter (bitterness from the coffee) is awesome. You should ask for less ice though- they stuffed my cup to the brim with ice, so I sipped like 4 times and the coffee was gone. My friends really enjoyed the sandwich meals, which come with a small pho soup and a drink. I think they cost around 8 bucks! Not bad at all! A great place for "to go" items as well like baguettes (1.50 for 3 small baguettes! and petite macarons.. They also serve interesting Vietnamese desserts that are packaged delightfully.

53.description: This is an adorable Vietnamese bakery/food to go place in Argyle that I love. Whenever I am in the area, I always stop by to pick up a few treats to take home.Highlights: CA PHE SUA DA (Vietnamese Iced Coffee) - ~$4; FYI: It is REALLY strong. If you need a wake up call, this is it. I drank about a quarter of the cup and it got me wired. I would suggest diluting it with water if you can't handle caffeine. But it gets the job done, I was wide awake and very productive after drinking this.BANH MI (Vietnamese sandwich) - ~4-5; I like the #1, which is a combo of all the types of pate and ham in the sandwich. It is a good size for one meal and it is very filling. CHE (Vietnamese desserts) - ~$3-5; the store has a wide selection of che in the fridge and they are all so colorful. I would suggest the taro (khoai mon) or the che thai because those are my personal fave.The store also sells a wide variety of Vietnamese to go food that are pre-packaged and the quality seems fresh! They also sell macarons for less than $2/macaron, which is quite a steal but note, majority of the macarons have cracks in them so if you are thinking of getting them as gifts, have the worker select the prettier ones.The place also offers ample tables and seats for you to sit down and enjoy your food and drink and socialize.And unlike other Vietnamese to go places that are more "hole in the wall" type places, this place is very clean! The workers are friendly and service is fast!

30.description: It was fun to find delicious macaroons.

46.description: Ba Le has some of the best banh mi in town, and a lot of veggie and vegan options.  I recently discovered that Nhu Lan's vegan lemongrass tofu is better than the vegan options at Ba Le, but Ba Le is still really great, and a much more pleasant dine-in option (it's a bright and airy order-at-the-counter cafe).  Also, the vegan spring rolls here are AMAZING.

1.description: Ba Le does the bare minimum to be classified as Vietnamese food.  It's super bland.  The pork in the spring roll tasted like it was boiled, then microwaved without seasoning.  My Banh Mi sandwich was sloppy, not fresh and the bread was rock hard.  My wife couldn't eat more than 3 bites of her Vermicelli bowl... it was rough.  This place is lazy food.  No love.    The plus side, it is new, modern and cool.Oh - and the guy on the phone who took my order had the personality of a fart.  This place is bad for Vietnamese.  Lucky for them, Vietnamese, by nature, is awesome.

55.description: Love this place, I always get a sandwich if I'm in the area. I usually get their pork pate sandwich, and it's very good with the shrimp spring rolls on the side.

9.description: Whenever I am in the area I try to stop by.  Every single sandwich that I have tried has been delicious. I have not tried any of their desserts but they do look good as well.  This place is definitely worth checking out.

26.description: Just a head's up: this review is for their macarons/bakery section and not for their sandwiches.Walking into Ba Le is an experience: the smell is so overwhelming that you get a whiff even before you enter the building. And no, it's not a homey, bread-baking kind of smell. The smell is what I imagine the Ninja Turtles' hideout smells like, in addition to walking into the bathroom after Oktoberfest with The Klumps. There was a long line, which was all over the place, so it was hard to discern who to talk to in order to get macarons. These macarons looked super cute, especially in the display, and there were at least 20 different flavors. I was most intrigued by the blood orange one. I finally ventured over to the cashier and waited in line after several rude, entitled patrons, and asked who I can talk to in order to get some macarons. The cashier said to her, and then she picked up a tray of food and turned her back to me, fiddling around with some items behind the counter, ignoring me for a few beats before going over to the macaron case. Okay... I chose 6 macarons from the case and she put them in a small plastic container. It came to around $10, which seems fair. I was used to the macarons at Sucre in New Orleans, which are heavenly, so you can imagine that I had high hopes for these.When we got home, I opened the box and grabbed a macaron. It squished under the light pressure I applied with my thumb and forefinger. All of the macarons were mushy. They were in a refrigerated case. The first rule of Macaron Club is you do not put macarons in the fridge case. I smelled it, and it smelled like the aforementioned sewer/cabbage farts aroma that I was greeted with... nay, socked in the nose with... when I arrived in front of the store. I chalked it up to "hey, maybe this one isn't my thing", so I put that one back and tried another.Disgusting. Every single one of these macarons were awful. I understand how tough it is to make a macaron: it's nothing short of a miracle to get the cookies to set properly, let alone not break in half when you ice them. These had the taste and texture of a bag of Cheez-Its that was left in a storm drain, then scooped out and let dry on a picnic table at the zoo, but not before a goat peed on it. My poor stomach took forever to settle and I couldn't get the taste out of my mouth.I didn't try any of their other cakes or their chocolates, but something tells me that I wouldn't much care for those either.

25.description: Wow Glad i found this place! great sandwhiches that are unique and flavorful. the bread is on point! and there super affordable!! cool shop to don't be afraid to try the desserts. I had the Vietnamese Banana pudding which was really good. cant believe i ate at subway for the same price haha this place is way better.

12.description: I loooooove this place. This is my family's hot spot to grab a banh mi. The prices are reasonable compared to the neighboring restaurants who also serve banh mi. I love how the bread is always warm and crisp when I get it! My personal favorite is the cha tom with a side of vietnamese cafe sua da (iced coffee) that's a solid meal right there. The macaroons are not my personal favorite, but their bakery section with the eggsrolls definitely is delicious!Highly recommend if you're in a hurry and for a cheap eat! The bread is amazing here!

59.description: Banh sandwich is okay but they scrimp on the amount of meat in the sandwich and pack it w veggies instead. The bread is good and flaky. The floor is also rather dirty and topped w crumbs and the tables are kinda awkward and small to eat at... Macarons are ok--the passion fruit one was fluffy but the strawberry was flat and kinda dry. And small. Won't be back here!

21.description: Ordered the banh mi bi chay (vegetarian) and Viet iced coffee.The banh mi was alright. It had tofu which was pretty bland with little flavor. I'm also used to banh mi seasoned with soy sauce but it didn't seem like this one had any. The quality of the bread was also okay; I prefer the bread to be more crispy than it was. Iced coffee was a pretty big portion and decent!To be fair, I did just come back from a summer in Vietnam so my expectations are higher than average. Will probably be back due to the lack of Viet food places in the area!

17.description: I've been here multiple times during visits to Chicago.  They are known for their bahn mi sandwiches but they also have other stuff like summer rolls, sugar cane shrimp, bottled beverages, rice puddings, and a large selection of baked goods. Its kind of like a Vietnamese fast food restaurant.  Everything i have had has been good.  I almost always get a bahn mi to go. Try it.  You will like it.

10.description: One of the best Banh Mi's joints in chicago!!!!! Very generous in their portion and reasonable in price. At least for the area! I always get the banh mi thit nuong or dac biet. they're both really good and flavorful! love their banh mi special buy 5 get 1 free! I always end up ordering 10 and going home with a dozen!they also have other goodies inside their shop too. the vietnamese snacks are always good! one thing that i didn't care for too much were their macaroons. i know that ba le bakery is trying to be a little fancy by adding macaroons and their logo is an effile tower but they should really just stick to banh mi! Their macaroons were not fresh and deff. not good at all! they deff. tasted old and stale. such a disappointment considering its $1.65 for one tiny macaroon. overall, great hot food! pass on the macaroons and chocolate. stick what they're really known for.

And no, it's not a homey, bread-baking kind of smell. The smell is what I imagine the Ninja Turtles' hideout smells like, in addition to walking into the bathroom after Oktoberfest with The Klumps. My poor stomach took forever to settle and I couldn't get the taste out of my mouth.I didn't try any of their other cakes or their chocolates, but something tells me that I wouldn't much care for those either.

3.description: Stopped by here after eating some pho so we were looking for some dessert.  We got some of their mini macaroons and they were pretty good.  They're a bit pricey at $1.65 a piece so it adds up!  We got the following flavors: green tea, nutella, coffee, pistachio, and sweet basil.  All of them were very good except the sweet basil.  We were just curious to see what it would taste like and it tasted exactly like basil...that was sweet :)  They also have several choices for banh mi's and other Vietnamese dishes, so you can get all kinds of stuff here!

35.description: Banh mi is pretty good with the baget toasted. I grew up eating banh mi and it typically wasn't served/eaten that way, but don't get me wrong, it's still good! Just not my favorite. The store front has some good packed foods and there's also not much seating available, just a FYI if you're thinking of eating here.

19.description: This review is for the macarons.For the most part, I love the macarons from Ba Le. I love how they got it right. The outer shell was crispy but not dry. The fillings were consistent and not too sweet. For $1.65 per macaron, the value can't be beat. However I had 2 or 3 macarons that were absolute disaster. They were hard!!! I'm pretty forgiving when it comes to pastries but these macarons, I tell you, unforgivable! That is why I'm only giving Ba Le 3 stars for the macarons. With that said, however, I know I'll be back. I really can't resist esp with that price. $1.65 for a good macaron is a steal.

28.description: Come for the sandwices, come back for the smoothies.

45.description: This was soooo good. Every time we are in Chicago, I can't wait to go here first. I like their special sandwich the most. You can buy their bread separately and that's always a treat. As always it's crowed but the service was fast and efficient. I would recommend this place to anyone who appreciate a good sandwich.

33.description: Probably the best part about this neighborhood. Ba Le is super clean, friendly, and affordable. The Vietnamese coffee is sweet and thick and all the bahn mi are excellent. The standout here is the amazing baguettes that have a crust that is amazingly crisp. Don't miss it.

43.description: This place has AMAZING EVERYTHING! Even my super picky son was able to find something to eat here. My husband always get the bbq pork and he loves it so much he orders two at a time. I'm obsessed with the veggie avocado and the spring rolls!

2.description: I have been coming to this place for years. It's damn good if you love a different kind of something to eat. Watch out for those fresh Hot Jalapeño Peppers on that Sammich from Vietnam baby! Woo!!You have to realize how lucky you all are to be living in Chicago. There aren't many places that can do it like Ba Le Bakery.

18.description: I am a fan of the prices. For what the sandwiches cost, the taste is good and the portions are filling for a small person. You might  be a bit hungry if you can eat a lot. I ordered a vegan chicken sandwich, and I was impressed by the combination of flavors. I was a little disappointed by high sodium content. My stomach did not feel too good afterwards. I also ordered the Vietnamese iced coffee. It is very bold but it's very sweet. The combination of sweet and bitter (bitterness from the coffee) is awesome. You should ask for less ice though- they stuffed my cup to the brim with ice, so I sipped like 4 times and the coffee was gone. My friends really enjoyed the sandwich meals, which come with a small pho soup and a drink. I think they cost around 8 bucks! Not bad at all! A great place for "to go" items as well like baguettes (1.50 for 3 small baguettes! and petite macarons.. They also serve interesting Vietnamese desserts that are packaged delightfully.

41.description: Tasty, lot of fixings and variety of sandwiches

52.description: Great pace to get sandwiches to go. Chinese pork my favorite. Skip the smoothies with tapioca. Baked goods and other items are good that day, but don't let them sit in the fridge.

50.description: I just recently started ordering from this place and cannot believe I've gone this long without it! Delicious sandwiches, rice dishes, and smoothies. I definitely plan on ordering food here more often. Highly recommended.

4.description: Buy 5 sandwiches get 1 free. My favorite sandwiches are the bale special and BBQ pork bah mi. This place always has great Vietnamese sandwiches and other foods to compliment them.

6.description: I've only had sandwiches here (Tank Noddle across the street is the best pho). They are amazing and flavorful. Get the BBQ pork and lemongrass pork. Cost around 10 bucks for two.

22.description: I am forever on a quest for the best banh mi, this Ba Le banh mi is legit and easily one of the best banh mi I have ever had.  And I have had banh mi from Hawaii, California, Vancouver and other random US states.My sandwich was well assembled, meat to veggie ratio was spot on, I had a pork roll and pate, all the fillings tasted and smelled great.They toasted the baguette before they assembled the sandwich, even though I had just had a big dinner, I had to try this sandwich right away in order to give it a fair assessment, bread was one of the better kind, crispy outside, soft inside with enough bite / substance to it.  I did notice when I smelled the sandwich with the paper wrapper, it had a weird, non-pleasant smell to it.  If you roll down the wrapper, then it smells fine.  I couldn't finish the sandwich, when I ate most of it the next morning, the bread was rather chewy, which is not their fault.  The only reason I didn't give this a 5 is because I didn't smell that wonderful aroma from bread that some other places have.  While they have the perfect texture (after heated), still missing that elusive touch.  But this is definitely the best banh mi that I have been able to find across all places!!  Chicagoans are lucky to have this!!

15.description: Best báhn mì I have had since moving from the San Jose/San Francisco area!  The daily pickle is tasty, the meat great, and the baguette PERFECT!

57.description: The sandwiches here are simply delicious. I ordered the lemongrass pork sandwich.  Mind you, not a big fan of pork but didn't mind at all since it tasted great . Highly recommend this place.

20.description: Having traveled and eaten some wonderful bahn mi in my time-I would have to say that they have room for improvement.  The bread is fresh and the condiments were good.  The meat on the other hand was what ruined it for me.  The chicken was dry, the BBQ pork was just "off" on the seasoning and the lemongrass pork seasoning didn't appeal to me.

36.description: One of the best Banh Mi's joints in chicago!!!!! Very generous in their portion and reasonable in price. At least for the area! I always get the banh mi thit nuong or dac biet. they're both really good and flavorful! love their banh mi special buy 5 get 1 free! I always end up ordering 10 and going home with a dozen!they also have other goodies inside their shop too. the vietnamese snacks are always good! one thing that i didn't care for too much were their macaroons. i know that ba le bakery is trying to be a little fancy by adding macaroons and their logo is an effile tower but they should really just stick to banh mi! Their macaroons were not fresh and deff. not good at all! they deff. tasted old and stale. such a disappointment considering its $1.65 for one tiny macaroon. overall, great hot food! pass on the macaroons and chocolate. stick what they're really known for.

14.description: A lot of the bakeries in the Argyle area are run-down and on the unsanitary side, but not Ba Le! This bakery is cleaner, better designed, as well as more tech-savvy than most of its neighboring businesses, and the food is sooooo good.Ba Le offers a huge variety of foods, from pho and banh mi to macarons and cakes. On the left side of the restaurant, you will find rows and rows of a variety of Vietnamese desserts, all of which are already packed in to-go cups. I bought a pudding-like taro dessert (Che Khoai Mon. $2.25) to take home, and I found that it was delicious and even contained chunks of real taro in a slightly milky puree.During my first visit here, I had a pho and BBQ pork bahn mi lunch combo (I couldn't decide which, so I had to opt for both), which was about $7. The bahn mi was toasted to perfection and very tasty. I've had the bahn mi at Tank and I honestly think the sandwiches here are much more flavorful. The pho was very comforting and just left me wishing I had more. The Vietnamese iced coffee is good and it comes in quite a large size, but it is quite strong so beware of the caffeine!If you're craving good Vietnamese food/snacks and you want a relatively clean environment, Ba Le is the way to go. It's also great if you're in a rush - they have spring rolls and many other yummy snacks that are meant to be taken on the go!
